name: Hotel Daniel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in Graz at the Daniel hotel and our time in the room amounted to little more than 20 minutes after check in and 8 hours asleep! Still, from what we saw we were impressed.
reviews.title: Modern funk near to the station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel is situated slap bang to the Graz's central train station and ordinarily would have been a two minute hop,step and jump from the platform to the hotel lobby, however, current building work at the front of the station meant we had to do a 10 minute walk around the block to get to the hotel (there was a short cut which we found out about after checking in). The walk into the centre of town takes 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Modern, stylish and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Despite arriving 1 hour before the official check in the receptionist was more than hapy to allow us to check in early. The room was very cool looking and laid out in a boutiquey and funky style. The bathroom was splt screened with the toilet on one side of the sliding door and the wet room the other. The shower with the huge rain shower head was fantastic.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: 1 point dropped from the review due to the poor AC. Yes it worked but even on the coldest setting it was nowhere near cool enough and this made for an uncomfortable nights sleep in what was a humid night.
reviews.title: Worth it for the shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Aside from this i have absolutley nothing negative to say about the Hotel Daniel!
reviews.title: Theft at Hotel Daniel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel Daniel is one of the hotels in the chain of Design hotels (worth checking out the website - www.designhotels.com - and there is also a book). It's basically right next to train station and a pleasant short walk away from the old city centre.
reviews.title: Cosy and Stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: I really liked the lobby and reception because it's truly an eye candy with all those colors.
reviews.title: Young,stylish,clean and excellent value Hotel near Central Railwaystation in Graz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff is also very nice.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel room n meal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious enough, modern ikea style designed, the biggest plus in the room for me was enormous shower with that big round flat shower head... Who doesn't like a big shower when coming back to hotel.
reviews.title: Great design concept, excellent value for money, nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If going to Graz, than this is the hotel to book.
reviews.title: Don't judge a book by its cover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights at this hotel whilst exploring the area around Graz, and found it to be friendly and pleasant. Check-in was prompt and painless, and our room was comfortable and well equipped.
reviews.title: Stylish and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no complaints about the standard or cleanliness of the room we stayed in, which was a standard room on the 1st floor, however the shower is glass sided like the sister hotel in Vienna, which means that you probably shouldn't share this room with anyone you don't mind being naked in front of....
reviews.title: Well worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is standard fare and well stocked, with all the usual selection of meats and bread associated with a continental style. The staff are as always very friendly, and very quick to replenish anything that is running low.
reviews.title: great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Daniel is located away from the centre of town but we were able to walk down one road to the river and to the centre in about 15mins or so.
reviews.title: Does the trick

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Driving in and out of Graz is straight forward and we were able to park outside the front of the hotel without any problem whatsoever. I should mention that our SatNav, which is a TomTom loaded with the latest austrian map updates, did try to take us down a couple of roads the wrong way, most notably the main road when leaving the hotel, so turn right and not left.. as i did (very embarrassing).
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Daniel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very enjoyable stay at Hotel Daniel. It is conveniently located next to the train station and only a 15 minute walk into the town centre. The rooms were a good size and the design touches made them interesting (especially the shower)! particuarly good breakfast and all in all a really good value hotel.
reviews.title: really good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Even though the hotel is very clean and OK for the price, the staff was a litle rude and impolite. They offered me what appeared to be free coffee but then they charged me for it.
reviews.title: Good hotel. Staff is not so friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a 3 nights/pay for 2 stay on Hotel Daniel's website. No where was it mentioned that the entire block surrounding the hotel is a 'construction zone / work site'. It's a real mess! Note, that much of the entry to the Old Town of Graz is also under construction as the city relay's its tram tracks. A real disappointment, upon our arrival. Regardless, Hotel Daniel is a fashionable, well appointed hotel that serves a sensational breakfast. The room we stayed in on the 4th floor was clean, the bed comfortable and had a great shower.
reviews.title: Area under construction! Fashionable hotel & Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room is tiny and well suited for a couple rather than for a parent and a child. It takes about 20 mins to get to the downtown walking.
reviews.title: It's ok...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were supposed to be free internet there but it was inaccessible on my floor... only in the lobby.
reviews.title: A Real Design hotel - 100 meters from Hauptbahnhof, strassenbahnline at backdoor

description: Modern hotel located in a commercial area; close to the railway station & all motorways; near the Congress Centre & museums.
